verses.roman:
śuni, śacī-miśrera duḥkhī haila mana
tabe prabhu mātā-pitāra kaila āśvāsana

synonyms: śuni'-hearing this; śacī—of mother Śacī; miśrera—and of Jagannātha Miśra; duḥkhī—very unhappy; haila—became; mana—minds; tabe—at that time; prabhu—Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu; mātā-pitāra—of the parents; kaila—did; āśvāsana—pacification.
translation: When Śacīmātā and Jagannātha Miśra heard of the departure of their elder son, Viśvarūpa, they were very unhappy, but Lord Caitanya tried to console them.
